meanings.definition: A highly contagious viral infection causing fever, aching muscles, and respiratory symptoms.
meanings.sent1: Last winter, the flu spread quickly through the school, making many students sick.
meanings.sent2: My mom got the flu and had to stay in bed for a week.
meanings.sent3: The flu decided to visit the town just in time for the holidays, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The flu crept through the community like a silent intruder, affecting everyone in its path.
meanings.sent5: The flu was like an unwelcome guest that overstayed its welcome, leaving a trail of tissues and coughs behind.
meanings.sent6: Despite getting the flu shot, I still caught the flu and had to miss school.
meanings.sent7: The flu season always brings a wave of sickness to the city, with people coughing and sneezing everywhere.
meanings.sent8: When the flu knocked on my door, I knew I was in for a rough few days.
meanings.sent9: The flu outbreak in the office led to half the staff calling in sick.
meanings.sent10: The flu virus seemed to have a mind of its own, targeting the most vulnerable individuals.
